availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, attorney. New Hampshire native. Married to Lydia Mooar. Father of Elizabeth Mooar, Oriana Mooar, Charles Mooar, Clara Mooar. Attorney in Kenton County in 1850. Employed Charles Mooar and Wright Southgate as attorneys in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Kenton County in 1850. Attorney in Kenton County in 1860. Employed Patrick Dugan as a servant in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 5, p. 149B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, p. 3 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 5, p. 736.
Find A Grave, "Daniel Mooar (1815-1896)," Memorial 113629704, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113629704 (accessed April 8, 2020).
